name: mendicant
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone, especially a member of a religious group, who lives by asking people they do not know for money: She abandoned her job and her career, and lived as a homeless mendicant on the streets of Philadelphia.

relating to a mendicant or to the religious group they belong to, or to someone who lives in a similar way: Vagrant and mendicant priests of every denomination had flocked into the city. Male members of the mendicant orders also acted as nurses in the Middle Ages.
